computeLeavesDominated

public static int computeLeavesDominated(PTBTreeNode node,
                                         int nextLeaf)
Adds the indices of the leaves dominated by a node in the node's userData.

isClause

public static boolean isClause(PTBTreeNode node)
Returns true iff the node is a clause. A node is a clause iff one of the following hold:
  • The label starts with S
  • The label is PRN, and the node has a child labeled S or VP
  • The label is PP and the node has a child labeled S.

isPunctOrTraceContainer

public static boolean isPunctOrTraceContainer(PTBTreeNode node)
Returns true iff a node dominates only punctuation or traces.

isBarrier

public static boolean isBarrier(PTBTreeNode node)
Returns true iff a node is a barrier. A node is a barrier iff the following conditions hold:
  • !isPunctOrTraceContainer(node)
  • isClause(node)
  • If the parent is a clause, then it has a child other than node such that !isPunctOrTraceContainer(child)

computeBarrierState

public static void computeBarrierState(PTBTreeNode node,
                                       java.util.HashSet barrierSet,
                                       LeavesDominated ld)
Initializes the barrierSet with the barrier nodes with which ld has a containment or crossing relationship. Note that crossing here means overlap without proper containment.

checkBarrierState

public static boolean checkBarrierState(PTBTreeNode node,
                                        java.util.HashSet barrierSet,
                                        LeavesDominated ld)
Checks if barrierSet is respected by ld. This means that if ld contains a barrier, then it should be contained or crossed in the barrierSet . If ld crosses a barrier, then it should be crossed by barrierSet .

Fixes gorn addresses for case where a span which should have be contiguous was mistakenly split into multiple spans.

computePossibleLeaves

public static java.util.Vector computePossibleLeaves(PTBTreeNode root,
                                                     Span span)
Computes the possible leaves for a span to dominate. The idea is to compute leftmost and rightmost starting and ending points respectively. The leftmost and rightmost starting point will differ only due to punctuations or traces. The basic pattern is: 
 leftmostStart(Punct | Trace) * rightmostStart(Punct | Trace | Word)
 		* leftmostEnd(Punct | Trace) * rightmostEnd
The span's start is greater than or equal to leftmostStart and is less than or equal to rightmostStart . And similarly for the end points. Note that if the span goes across multiple sentences, we compute multiple PossibleLeaves objects, one for each sentence.

printLeaves

public static java.lang.String printLeaves(PTBTreeNode root,
                                           PossibleLeaves pl)

getLeavesDominated

public static java.util.Vector getLeavesDominated(PTBTreeNode root,
                                                  Span span,
                                                  boolean stretch)
Computes the leaves dominated by a span. The parameter stretch determines whether or not the span will be stretched. Only the span of a connective is not stretched. Note that if the span goes across multiple sentences, we compute multiple LeavesDominated objects, one for each sentence. The steps are as follows for each PossibleLeaves object returned by computePossibleLeaves :
  • Intialize the leaves dominated ld such that ld.start = pl.rightmostStart and ld.end = pl.leftmostEnd .
  • If stretch == false , we are done. Otherwise, we do the following:
    • Compute the barrierSet for ld
    • While the barrierSet is respected ( checkBarrierState(root,barrierSet,ld) ), move ld.start to the left, as long as it is greater than or equal to pl.leftmostStart .
    • Similarly stretch ld.end

addNodesContained

getGornAddressList

public static GornAddressList getGornAddressList(PTBTreeNode root,
                                                 SpanList splist,
                                                 boolean stretch)
Computes the gorn address for the span list. Starts by computing the leaves dominated, and then selects the highest nodes in the tree which dominate exactly those leaves. The label of the nodes in the root argument should be of type edu.upenn.cis.ptb.standoff.SPTBLabel .
